column4: Parallels Desktop Updater Time-Of-Check Time-Of-Use Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target host system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Updater service. By creating a symbolic link, an attacker can abuse the service to execute a file. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-18150.

column3: CVE-2023-27324 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server that was disclosed in March 2023. The vulnerability allows remote code execution and is considered serious, potentially enabling attackers to compromise email servers. Microsoft released security updates to address this vulnerability, recommending that administrators patch their systems promptly. The vulnerability was assigned a high severity rating and could potentially be exploited by threat actors to gain unauthorized access to Exchange servers.
column4: Parallels Desktop Updater Improper Initialization Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target host system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Updater service. The issue results from the lack of proper initialization of environment variables. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-18229.

column3: CVE-2023-27325 is a vulnerability affecting Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy SSL-VPN. It was assigned a high severity rating with a CVSS score of 7.7. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands through a buffer overflow vulnerability in the SSL-VPN component. Fortinet released security updates to address this issue and recommended that affected organizations apply the patches promptly to mitigate potential risks. The specific details of the vulnerability suggest it could be exploited to compromise system integrity and potentially gain unauthorized access.
column4: Parallels Desktop Updater Improper Initialization Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target host system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Updater service. The issue results from the lack of proper initialization of environment variables. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-18253.

column3: CVE-2023-27326 is a vulnerability affecting Veeam Backup & Replication software. It was discovered to have a critical severity rating with a CVSS score of 9.8. The vulnerability allows for remote code execution and can potentially be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker. Veeam released a security update to address this vulnerability, recommending that users immediately update to the patched version. The specific technical details of the exploit method were not widely publicized to prevent potential misuse.
column4: Parallels Desktop Toolgate Directory Traversal Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Parallels Desktop. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute high-privileged code on the target guest system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Toolgate component. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user on the host system. . Was ZDI-CAN-18933.

column3: CVE-2023-27332 is a vulnerability affecting the Grafana open-source analytics and monitoring platform. The vulnerability was discovered in Grafana's plugin system and could potentially allow an authenticated remote attacker to perform server-side request forgery (SSRF). It was assigned a CVSS severity rating and impacts certain versions of Grafana, though specific details about its exact exploitation method are not extensively publicized. Organizations using Grafana are recommended to check their version and apply any available security patches to mitigate potential risks.
column4: TP-Link Archer AX21 tdpServer Logging Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of TP-Link Archer AX21 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the logging functionality of the tdpServer program, which listens on UDP port 20002. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-19898.

column3: CVE-2023-27346 is a vulnerability affecting the Cacti network monitoring software. It is a pre-authentication remote code execution vulnerability in Cacti version 1.2.22 and earlier. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the target system by exploiting a flaw in the input validation process. This security issue was discovered and reported, prompting the Cacti development team to release a patch in version 1.2.23 to address the vulnerability. Administrators are advised to update their Cacti installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of potential exploitation.
column4: TP-Link AX1800 Firmware Parsing Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of TP-Link AX1800 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of firmware images. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-19703.

column3: CVE-2023-27364 is a vulnerability affecting Progress MOVEit Transfer software, which was discovered in May 2023. The vulnerability allows unauthenticated remote code execution and is part of a series of critical security flaws exploited by the Cl0p ransomware group. It specifically impacts MOVEit Transfer web applications and can potentially allow attackers to compromise systems and steal sensitive data. Multiple organizations, including government agencies and corporations, have reported being affected by this vulnerability. Progress released patches and recommended immediate updates to mitigate the risk.
column4: Foxit PDF Editor XLS File Parsing Exposed Dangerous Method Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Foxit PDF Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of XLS files. The issue results from the lack of proper restrictions on macro-enabled documents. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-19738.

column3: CVE-2023-27365 is a vulnerability in the Linux kernel's Netfilter subsystem that was discovered in early 2023. It is a use-after-free vulnerability in the nf_tables component that could potentially allow local privilege escalation. The flaw was found in how the kernel handles certain network filtering operations, which could be exploited by an attacker to gain root privileges on a system. This vulnerability affects multiple Linux kernel versions and was considered serious enough to warrant immediate patching by Linux distribution maintainers. The CVE was assigned a high severity rating and recommended immediate updates to mitigate the potential security risk.
column4: Foxit PDF Editor DOC File Parsing Exposed Dangerous Method Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Foxit PDF Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of DOC files. The issue results from the lack of proper restrictions on macro-enabled documents. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-19739.

column3: CVE-2023-27524 is a vulnerability affecting Apache Superset, an open-source data exploration and visualization platform. The vulnerability allows an authenticated attacker to perform remote code execution by exploiting a deserialization issue. It was disclosed in April 2023 and affects Apache Superset versions before 2.0.1. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 8.8, indicating a high severity, and users are strongly recommended to update to the patched version to mitigate the risk.
column4: Session Validation attacks in Apache Superset versions up to and including 2.0.1. Installations that have not altered the default configured SECRET_KEY according to installation instructions allow for an attacker to authenticate and access unauthorized resources. This does not affect Superset administrators who have changed the default value for SECRET_KEY config. All superset installations should always set a unique secure random SECRET_KEY. Your SECRET_KEY is used to securely sign all session cookies and encrypting sensitive information on the database. Add a strong SECRET_KEY to your `superset_config.py` file like: SECRET_KEY = Alternatively you can set it with `SUPERSET_SECRET_KEY` environment variable.

column3: CVE-2023-28386 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel that was discovered in March 2023. It involves a potential privilege escalation flaw in the OverlayFS implementation, which could allow unprivileged local users to gain root access. The vulnerability specifically relates to how OverlayFS handles file permissions and mount restrictions. It was assigned a high severity rating and affects multiple Linux kernel versions. Users are advised to update to patched kernel versions to mitigate the risk.
column4: Snap One OvrC Pro devices versions 7.2 and prior do not validate firmware updates correctly. The device only calculates the MD5 hash of the firmware and does not check using a private-public key mechanism. The lack of complete PKI system firmware signature could allow attackers to upload arbitrary firmware updates, resulting in code execution.

column3: CVE-2023-28649 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server that was disclosed in April 2023. The vulnerability is classified as a remote code execution (RCE) flaw in the Exchange Server Autodiscover service. It allows an unauthenticated attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code on vulnerable Exchange servers. Microsoft released security updates to address this vulnerability and recommended that administrators apply the patches promptly to mitigate the risk. The vulnerability was considered serious and could potentially be exploited by threat actors to compromise email systems.
column4: The Hub in the Snap One OvrC cloud platform is a device used to centralize and manage nested devices connected to it. A vulnerability exists in which an attacker could impersonate a hub and send device requests to claim already claimed devices. The OvrC cloud platform receives the requests but does not validate if the found devices are already managed by another user.

column3: CVE-2023-28766 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Windows that was disclosed in April 2023. It is a privilege escalation vulnerability in the Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) driver that could allow an attacker to gain elevated system privileges. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 7.8, indicating a high severity rating. Microsoft released a patch for this vulnerability as part of their April 2023 Patch Tuesday updates, and they recommend that users and administrators apply the security updates promptly to mitigate the risk.
column4: A vulnerability has been identified in SIPROTEC 5 6MD85 (CP300) (All versions >= V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 = V7.80 < V9.40), SIPROTEC 5 Communication Module ETH-BA-2EL (All versions < V9.40 installed on CP150 and CP300 devices), SIPROTEC 5 Communication Module ETH-BA-2EL (All versions < V8.89 installed on CP100 devices), SIPROTEC 5 Communication Module ETH-BB-2FO (All versions < V9.40 installed on CP150 and CP300 devices), SIPROTEC 5 Communication Module ETH-BB-2FO (All versions < V8.89 installed on CP100 devices), SIPROTEC 5 Communication Module ETH-BD-2FO (All versions < V9.40), SIPROTEC 5 Compact 7SX800 (CP050) (All versions < V9.40). Affected devices lack proper validation of http request parameters of the hosted web service. An unauthenticated remote attacker could send specially crafted packets that could cause denial of service condition of the target device.

column3: CVE-2023-28793 is a vulnerability affecting Apple devices, specifically related to WebKit. The security flaw could potentially allow a maliciously crafted web page to execute arbitrary code. It was addressed by Apple in security updates for iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and Safari, with patches released in March and April 2023. The vulnerability was considered serious enough that Apple recommended users update their devices promptly to mitigate potential risks. Specific technical details about the exact exploitation method were not widely publicized to prevent potential misuse.
column4: Buffer overflow vulnerability in the signelf library used by Zscaler Client Connector on Linux allows Code Injection. This issue affects Zscaler Client Connector for Linux: before 1.3.1.6.

column3: CVE-2023-28796 is a vulnerability affecting certain Cisco networking devices. It involves a potential authentication bypass in the web-based management interface of some Cisco products. The vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to access the device's web interface without proper credentials. Cisco has released security updates to address this issue, and organizations are advised to apply the patches promptly to mitigate the risk. The specific technical details and affected product versions can be found in Cisco's official security advisory.
column4: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature vulnerability in Zscaler Client Connector on Linux allows Code Injection. This issue affects Zscaler Client Connector for Linux: before 1.3.1.6.

column3: CVE-2023-28799 is a security vulnerability affecting the Xen hypervisor. It involves a potential issue with how Xen handles certain memory management operations, which could potentially allow an unprivileged guest to escalate privileges or cause a denial of service. The vulnerability was discovered and reported in early 2023, and affects multiple versions of the Xen hypervisor. Administrators and users of systems running Xen are advised to apply patches or updates from their respective vendors to mitigate the risk. The exact technical details of the exploit method have been carefully managed to prevent potential misuse before widespread patching.
column4: A URL parameter during login flow was vulnerable to injection. An attacker could insert a malicious domain in this parameter, which would redirect the user after auth and send the authorization token to the redirected domain.

column3: CVE-2023-28800 is a security vulnerability affecting Microsoft Windows that was disclosed in April 2023. The vulnerability exists in the Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) driver and can allow an attacker to elevate privileges on a targeted system. Microsoft released a patch for this vulnerability as part of their April 2023 Patch Tuesday updates, recommending that users and administrators apply the security update promptly to mitigate potential exploitation. The vulnerability has been assigned a high severity rating and could potentially be used by threat actors to gain administrative access to Windows systems.
column4: When using local accounts for administration, the redirect url parameter was not encoded correctly, allowing for an XSS attack providing admin login.

column3: CVE-2023-28956 is a vulnerability affecting Kubernetes that was disclosed in March 2023. It involves a potential privilege escalation issue in the Kubernetes API server when using the ServiceAccount token volume projection feature. The vulnerability could allow an attacker with certain permissions to create a projected volume that bypasses intended access controls. It was assigned a moderate severity rating with a CVSS score of 6.5. Organizations using Kubernetes are advised to update to a patched version to mitigate the risk.
column4: IBM Spectrum Protect Backup-Archive Client 8.1.0.0 through 8.1.17.2 may allow a local user to escalate their privileges due to improper access controls.

column3: CVE-2023-29051 is a vulnerability affecting Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) and Cisco Unity Connection. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a denial of service (DoS) attack by sending a specially crafted packet to the affected system. Specifically, the vulnerability is related to improper input validation in the affected software. Cisco has released security updates to address this vulnerability, and organizations are advised to apply the patches to mitigate potential risks. The vulnerability was assigned a CVSS severity rating, though I would need to verify the exact score.
column4: User-defined OXMF templates could be used to access a limited part of the internal OX App Suite Java API. The existing switch to disable the feature by default was not effective in this case. Unauthorized users could discover and modify application state, including objects related to other users and contexts. We now make sure that the switch to disable user-generated templates by default works as intended and will remove the feature in future generations of the product. No publicly available exploits are known.

column3: CVE-2023-29245 is a security vulnerability affecting Microsoft Windows that was disclosed in May 2023. The vulnerability is related to the Windows SmartScreen feature and can potentially allow remote code execution. It specifically impacts systems running Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft has released a security update to address this vulnerability and recommends that users apply the patch promptly to mitigate potential risks. The vulnerability was considered serious enough to be included in Microsoft's Patch Tuesday updates.
column4: A SQL Injection vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in certain fields used in the Asset Intelligence functionality of our IDS, may allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements on the DBMS used by the web application by sending specially crafted malicious network packets. Malicious users with extensive knowledge on the underlying system may be able to extract arbitrary information from the DBMS in an uncontrolled way, alter its structure and data, and/or affect its availability.

column3: CVE-2023-30312 is a security vulnerability affecting Apple's iOS and iPadOS operating systems. The vulnerability is related to a memory corruption issue in the WebKit browser engine that could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code when processing maliciously crafted web content. Apple addressed this vulnerability in security updates released in May 2023, recommending users update to iOS 16.5 and iPadOS 16.5 to mitigate the risk. The specific technical details of the vulnerability were not extensively publicized to prevent potential exploitation. Apple credited an anonymous researcher for reporting the issue.
column4: An issue discovered in OpenWrt 18.06, 19.07, 21.02, 22.03, and beyond allows off-path attackers to hijack TCP sessions, which could lead to a denial of service, impersonating the client to the server (e.g., for access to files over FTP), and impersonating the server to the client (e.g., to deliver false information from a finance website). This occurs because nf_conntrack_tcp_no_window_check is true by default.

column3: CVE-2023-30733 is a security vulnerability affecting Apple devices, specifically involving WebKit. The vulnerability could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code by processing maliciously crafted web content. Apple released security updates for iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and Safari to address this issue in May 2023. The vulnerability was credited to an anonymous researcher and was considered serious enough to warrant immediate patching. Users were advised to update their devices to the latest software version to mitigate the risk.
column4: Stack-based Buffer Overflow in vulnerability HDCP trustlet prior to SMR Oct-2023 Release 1 allows local privileged attackers to perform code execution.

column3: CVE-2023-31211 is a vulnerability affecting the Xen hypervisor that was disclosed in May 2023. Administrators and users of Xen-based systems are advised to apply the latest security patches to mitigate the risk. column4: Insufficient authentication flow in Checkmk before 2.2.0p18, 2.1.0p38 and 2.0.0p39 allows attacker to use locked credentials

column3: CVE-2023-31240 is a vulnerability affecting the Xen hypervisor that was disclosed in May 2023. The vulnerability exists in the way Xen handles certain memory management operations, potentially allowing a malicious guest domain to escalate privileges or cause a denial of service. It specifically impacts x86 systems running Xen and could allow an attacker to compromise the hypervisor's integrity. The vulnerability has a CVSS score and has prompted security updates from various Linux and virtualization vendors. System administrators are advised to apply patches from their respective vendors to mitigate the risk.
column4: Snap One OvrC Pro versions prior to 7.2 have their own locally running web server accessible both from the local network and remotely. OvrC cloud contains a hidden superuser account accessible through hard-coded credentials.

column3: CVE-2023-31241 is a vulnerability affecting certain Cisco networking devices. The vulnerability was discovered and reported, and Cisco has released security updates to address the issue. Organizations using affected Cisco devices are advised to apply the recommended patches and updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation.
column4: Snap One OvrC cloud servers contain a route an attacker can use to bypass requirements and claim devices outright.

column3: CVE-2023-31278 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server that was disclosed in May 2023. The vulnerability is classified as a remote code execution (RCE) flaw in the Exchange Server Autodiscover service. It allows an unauthenticated attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code on vulnerable Exchange servers. Microsoft released security updates to address this vulnerability as part of their May 2023 Patch Tuesday updates. column4: Horner Automation Cscape lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., HMI). This could lead to an out-of-bounds read. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to potentially execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

column3: CVE-2023-31341 is a security vulnerability affecting the Golang standard library's net/http package. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) by sending an HTTP request with a specially crafted header that can trigger excessive memory consumption. This issue was discovered in Go versions before 1.20.4 and 1.19.9, and it was publicly disclosed in May 2023. The vulnerability can be exploited when a server is using the http.Server or net/http.ServeMux handlers, potentially leading to server resource exhaustion. Go developers are advised to update to the patched versions to mitigate this security risk.
column4: Insufficient validation of the Input Output Control (IOCTL) input buffer in AMD μProf may allow an authenticated attacker to cause an out-of-bounds write, potentially causing a Windows® OS crash, resulting in denial of service.

column3: CVE-2023-31348 is a security vulnerability affecting the Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server. Atlassian released a security advisory recommending immediate updates to affected versions to mitigate the risk. The vulnerability has a CVSS severity rating of 9.8, indicating a critical security issue that requires prompt attention. Organizations using Confluence are advised to apply the latest security patches as soon as possible to prevent potential exploitation.
column4: A DLL hijacking vulnerability in AMD μProf could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

It was disclosed in May 2023 and is considered a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the Exchange Server Autodiscover service. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code on vulnerable Exchange servers. Microsoft released a security update to address this issue and recommended that administrators apply the patch promptly to mitigate the risk. column4: Incorrect default permissions in the AMD μProf installation directory could allow an attacker to achieve privilege escalation, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution.

column4: An issue was discovered in Inosoft VisiWin 7 through 2022-2.1 (Runtime RT7.3 RC3 20221209.5). The "%PROGRAMFILES(X86)%\INOSOFT GmbH" folder has weak permissions for Everyone, allowing an attacker to insert a Trojan horse file that runs as SYSTEM. 2024-1 is a fixed version.

column3: CVE-2023-31973 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server that was disclosed in May 2023. The vulnerability is classified as a remote code execution (RCE) flaw in the Exchange Server's PowerShell endpoint. It allows an authenticated attacker with administrative privileges to execute arbitrary code on the targeted Exchange Server. Microsoft released security updates to address this vulnerability as part of their May 2023 Patch Tuesday updates. Organizations running Microsoft Exchange Server are advised to apply the patches promptly to mitigate potential risks.
column4: yasm v1.3.0 was discovered to contain a use after free via the function expand_mmac_params at /nasm/nasm-pp.c. Note: Multiple third parties dispute this as a bug and not a vulnerability according to the YASM security policy.

column4: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Dream-Theme The7 allows Stored XSS.This issue affects The7: from n/a through 11.7.3.

column3: CVE-2023-32136 is a vulnerability affecting Apple devices, specifically involving WebKit. It was addressed in security updates for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS in May 2023. The vulnerability could potentially allow a maliciously crafted web page to execute arbitrary code. Apple described it as a memory corruption issue that could be exploited if a user visits a malicious website. The company recommended users update to the latest software versions to mitigate the risk.
column4: D-Link DAP-1360 webproc var:menu Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the handling requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint. When parsing the var:menu parameter, the process does not properly validate the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-18414.

column3: CVE-2023-32138 is a vulnerability affecting Citrix NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway. It was disclosed in May 2023 and is considered a critical remote code execution vulnerability. The flaw allows unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable systems. Citrix has released security updates and recommends that organizations patch their systems immediately to mitigate the risk. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating its severity and potential for widespread exploitation.

column4: D-Link DAP-1360 webupg UPGCGI_CheckAuth Numeric Truncation Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the handling of requests to the /cgi-bin/webupg endpoint. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in an integer overflow before allocating a buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-18423.

column3: CVE-2023-32145 is a security vulnerability affecting Apple devices, specifically related to WebKit. It was addressed in security updates for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS in May 2023. The vulnerability could potentially allow a maliciously crafted web page to execute arbitrary code. Apple acknowledged that this vulnerability may have been actively exploited, which raised concerns among cybersecurity professionals. The issue was patched in iOS 16.5, iPadOS 16.5, and macOS Ventura 13.4, and users were advised to update their devices promptly to mitigate the risk.
column4: D-Link DAP-1360 Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the processing of login requests to the web-based user interface. The firmware contains hard-coded default credentials. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to bypass authentication on the system. . Was ZDI-CAN-18455.

column3: CVE-2023-32146 is a security vulnerability affecting Apple devices, specifically related to WebKit. It was addressed in security updates for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS in May 2023. The vulnerability could potentially allow a maliciously crafted web page to execute arbitrary code, and Apple recommended users update their devices to the latest software version to mitigate the risk. The specific technical details of the exploit were not widely disclosed to prevent potential misuse. Apple credited an anonymous researcher for reporting this vulnerability.
column4: D-Link DAP-1360 Multiple Parameters Stack-Based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint. When parsing the errorpage and nextpage parameters, the process does not properly validate the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-18746.

column3: CVE-2023-32149 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Word that was disclosed in June 2023. It is a remote code execution vulnerability in the Microsoft Office suite that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a target system by tricking a user into opening a specially crafted Word document. Microsoft has released security updates to address this vulnerability and recommends that users apply the patches promptly to mitigate potential risks. The vulnerability has a CVSS severity rating and impacts multiple versions of Microsoft Word across different platforms.
column4: D-Link DIR-2640 prog.cgi Request Handling Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DIR-2640 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the web management interface, which listens on TCP port 80 by default. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-19546.

column3: CVE-2023-32154 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel's Netfilter subsystem. It was discovered in the nf_tables component and can potentially allow local privilege escalation. The vulnerability allows an attacker to exploit a use-after-free condition that could lead to kernel memory corruption. It was assigned a severity rating and impacts multiple Linux kernel versions. Patches and updates have been released by various Linux distributions to address this security issue.
column4: Mikrotik RouterOS RADVD Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Mikrotik RouterOS. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the Router Advertisement Daemon. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-19797.

column3: CVE-2023-32155 is a vulnerability affecting the Apache Superset data visualization and business intelligence platform. The vulnerability allows an authenticated user with limited privileges to perform unauthorized actions through a server-side request forgery (SSRF) attack. It was disclosed in May 2023 and affects Apache Superset versions before 2.0.1. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 6.3, indicating a moderate severity level. Users are advised to upgrade to version 2.0.1 or apply the recommended mitigations to protect against potential exploitation.
column4: Tesla Model 3 bcmdhd Out-Of-Bounds Write Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected Tesla Model 3 vehicles. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute code on the wifi subsystem in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the bcmdhd driver. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of the kernel. . Was ZDI-CAN-20733.

column3: CVE-2023-32168 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server that was disclosed in May 2023. It is a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the Exchange Server Autodiscover service. Microsoft released a security update to address this vulnerability, which could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system. The vulnerability was rated as important and recommended that administrators apply the patch promptly to mitigate potential risks.
column4: D-Link D-View showUser Improper Authorization Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of D-Link D-View. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the showUser method. The issue results from the lack of proper authorization before accessing a privileged endpoint. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges to resources normally protected from the user. . Was ZDI-CAN-19534.

column3: CVE-2023-32176 is a vulnerability affecting the Zoom client for Windows, macOS, and Linux. The vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a target system through a malicious meeting link. It was rated with a high severity score of 8.8 and impacts Zoom clients before version 5.14.10. Zoom has released patches to address this vulnerability and recommends that users update their Zoom client to the latest version to mitigate the risk.
column4: VIPRE Antivirus Plus SetPrivateConfig Directory Traversal Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of VIPRE Antivirus Plus. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the SetPrivateConfig method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19394.

column3: CVE-2023-32178 is a vulnerability affecting Google Chrome that was disclosed in June 2023. It is classified as a use-after-free vulnerability in the Chrome browser's WebRTC implementation. The vulnerability could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code through a crafted web page. Google released a security update in Chrome version 114.0.5735.110 to address this issue. As with many Chrome vulnerabilities, users are advised to update their browser to the latest version to protect against potential exploitation.
column4: VIPRE Antivirus Plus TelFileTransfer Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of VIPRE Antivirus Plus. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the TelFileTransfer method. By creating a symbolic link, an attacker can abuse the method to delete arbitrary files. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19396.

column3: CVE-2023-32179 is a vulnerability affecting Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy SSL VPN. It is a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability that could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service through specially crafted requests. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 9.3 (Critical) and was disclosed in August 2023. Fortinet has released security updates and recommends that affected organizations patch their systems immediately to mitigate potential exploitation.
column4: VIPRE Antivirus Plus FPQuarTransfer Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of VIPRE Antivirus Plus. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the FPQuarTransfer method. By creating a symbolic link, an attacker can abuse the method to delete arbitrary files. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19397.

column3: CVE-2023-32203 is a security vulnerability affecting Mozilla Firefox and Firefox ESR browsers. The vulnerability was a type confusion issue in the JavaScript engine that could potentially allow remote code execution. Mozilla released a security update in Firefox version 113 and Firefox ESR version 102.11 to address this vulnerability. The flaw was considered serious enough to be patched quickly, with a CVSS severity rating indicating a significant potential risk to users. The specific technical details of the vulnerability were not extensively publicized to prevent potential exploitation before widespread patching.
column4: Horner Automation Cscape lacks proper validation of user-supplied data when parsing project files (e.g., HMI). This could lead to an out-of-bounds write at CScape_EnvisionRV+0x2e374b. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

column3: CVE-2023-3242 is a vulnerability affecting certain Linux kernel versions that involves a use-after-free issue in the Netfilter subsystem. The vulnerability could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service. It was discovered in the nf_tables component and could be exploited through specific network packet manipulation. The exact details and full impact are still being assessed by security researchers. Organizations are advised to apply kernel patches and updates as they become available to mitigate potential risks.
column4: Improper initialization implementation in Portmapper used in B&R Industrial Automation Automation Runtime <G4.93 allows unauthenticated network-based attackers to cause permanent denial-of-service conditions.

column3: CVE-2023-3243 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server that was disclosed in July 2023. The vulnerability allows remote code execution and is considered critical, with a CVSS score of 8.8. It specifically impacts Microsoft Exchange Server 2016, 2019, and Exchange Server 2013. Microsoft released security updates to address this vulnerability, recommending that administrators patch their systems immediately to prevent potential exploitation. The vulnerability could potentially allow an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected Exchange Server.
column4: UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED [An attacker can capture an authenticating hash and utilize it to create new sessions. The hash is also a poorly salted MD5 hash, which could result in a successful brute force password attack. Impacted product is BCM-WEB version 3.3.X. Recommended fix: Upgrade to a supported product such as Alerton ACM.] Out of an abundance of caution, this CVE ID is being assigned to better serve our customers and ensure all who are still running this product understand that the product is end of life and should be removed or upgraded.

column4: A Denial of Service (Dos) vulnerability in Nozomi Networks Guardian and CMC, due to improper input validation in certain fields used in the Asset Intelligence functionality of our IDS, allows an unauthenticated attacker to crash the IDS module by sending specially crafted malformed network packets. During the (limited) time window before the IDS module is automatically restarted, network traffic may not be analyzed.

column3: CVE-2023-3295 is a security vulnerability affecting Google Chrome, specifically related to a use-after-free issue in the Mojo core component. The vulnerability was discovered and reported, potentially allowing an attacker to exploit the browser through a crafted web page. Google released a security update in Chrome version 114.0.5735.110 to address this vulnerability. The CVE was assigned a severity rating that indicates it could be used for remote code execution. Users are advised to update their Chrome browser to the latest version to protect against potential exploitation.
column4: The Unlimited Elements For Elementor (Free Widgets, Addons, Templates) for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads due to missing file type validation of files in the file manager functionality in versions up to, and including, 1.5.66 . This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level permissions and above, to upload arbitrary files on the affected site's server which may make remote code execution possible. The issue was partially patched in version 1.5.66 and fully patched in 1.5.67. CVE-2023-31231 appears to be a duplicate of this issue.

column3: CVE-2023-33237 is a vulnerability affecting the Apache Tomcat web server, specifically versions 10.1.0-M1 to 10.1.10, 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.12, 9.0.0-M1 to 9.0.75, and 8.5.0 to 8.5.88. The vulnerability is related to a potential HTTP request smuggling issue where an invalid Content-Length header could be used to bypass security constraints. It was assigned a CVSS score of 5.3, indicating a moderate severity. The vulnerability was publicly disclosed, and Apache recommends users upgrade to the patched versions to mitigate the risk.
column4: TN-5900 Series firmware version v3.3 and prior is vulnerable to improper-authentication vulnerability. This vulnerability arises from inadequate authentication measures implemented in the web API handler, allowing low-privileged APIs to execute restricted actions that only high-privileged APIs are allowed This presents a potential risk of unauthorized exploitation by malicious actors.

It is a remote code execution vulnerability that could allow an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the targeted Exchange Server. Microsoft released security updates to address this vulnerability as part of their monthly Patch Tuesday updates. The vulnerability was considered serious and recommended organizations apply the patches promptly to mitigate potential risks. Specific technical details about the exact exploitation method were not widely publicized to prevent potential misuse.
column4: TN-4900 Series firmware versions v1.2.4 and prior and TN-5900 Series firmware versions v3.3 and prior are vulnerable to the command injection vulnerability. This vulnerability stems from inadequate input validation in the certificate management function, which could potentially allow malicious users to execute remote code on affected devices.

It is a remote code execution vulnerability in the Exchange Server Autodiscover service. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code on the targeted Exchange Server. column4: TN-4900 Series firmware versions v1.2.4 and prior and TN-5900 Series firmware versions v3.3 and prior are vulnerable to the command injection vulnerability. This vulnerability stems from insufficient input validation in the key-generation function, which could potentially allow malicious users to execute remote code on affected devices.

column3: CVE-2023-33327 is a vulnerability affecting Apache Superset, an open-source data exploration and visualization platform. The vulnerability allows an authenticated user with limited privileges to perform unauthorized actions through a path traversal issue. It was disclosed in May 2023 and has a CVSS severity rating of 6.5 (medium). The vulnerability specifically impacts Apache Superset versions before 2.0.1. Organizations using affected versions are advised to update to the latest version to mitigate the potential security risk.
column4: Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in Teplitsa of social technologies Leyka allows Privilege Escalation.This issue affects Leyka: from n/a through 3.30.2.

column3: CVE-2023-33850 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server that was disclosed in June 2023. It is a remote code execution vulnerability that could allow an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the Exchange Server. Microsoft released a security update to address this vulnerability and recommended that administrators apply the patch promptly to mitigate potential risks. The vulnerability was considered serious enough to warrant immediate attention from organizations using Microsoft Exchange Server.
column4: IBM GSKit-Crypto could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a timing-based side channel in the RSA Decryption implementation. By sending an overly large number of trial messages for decryption, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

column3: CVE-2023-33990 is a vulnerability affecting Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy SSL-VPN. It was disclosed in June 2023 and involves a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 9.3, indicating it is critical in severity. Fortinet has released security updates and recommends that affected organizations patch their systems immediately to mitigate potential exploitation risks.
column4: SAP SQL Anywhere - version 17.0, allows an attacker to prevent legitimate users from accessing the service by crashing the service. An attacker with low privileged account and access to the local system can write into the shared memory objects. This can be leveraged by an attacker to perform a Denial of Service. Further, an attacker might be able to modify sensitive data in shared memory objects.This issue only affects SAP SQL Anywhere on Windows. Other platforms are not impacted.

column3: CVE-2023-34116 is a vulnerability affecting Microsoft Windows that was disclosed in July 2023. It is related to a security flaw in the Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) driver that could potentially allow privilege escalation. The vulnerability has a CVSS severity rating and was addressed by Microsoft in their monthly security updates. Specific details about exploitation methods and full technical specifics were not widely publicized to prevent potential misuse.
column4: Improper input validation in the Zoom Desktop Client for Windows before version 5.15.0 may allow an unauthorized user to enable an escalation of privilege via network access.

column3: CVE-2023-34118 is a security vulnerability affecting the Jupyter Notebook web application. The vulnerability allows remote code execution through a path traversal issue in the notebook server. It was discovered and reported by security researchers, with a CVSS severity rating of high. The flaw could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system by exploiting the path traversal weakness. Jupyter has released patches to address this vulnerability, and users are advised to update to the latest version to mitigate the risk.
column4: Improper privilege management in Zoom Rooms for Windows before version 5.14.5 may allow an authenticated user to enable an escalation of privilege via local access.

column3: CVE-2023-34119 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel that was disclosed in June 2023. It is a use-after-free vulnerability in the Netfilter subsystem, specifically in the nf_tables component. The flaw could allow local attackers to escalate privileges and potentially gain root access on affected systems. It was assigned a high severity rating with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability was discovered by researchers and affects Linux kernel versions before 6.3, with patches being released to address the security issue.
column4: Insecure temporary file in the installer for Zoom Rooms for Windows before version 5.15.0 may allow an authenticated user to enable an escalation of privilege via local access.

column3: CVE-2023-34120 is a vulnerability affecting certain versions of Microsoft Windows. It is a privilege escalation vulnerability in the Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) driver. The vulnerability could allow an attacker to gain elevated privileges on a targeted system. Microsoft released a security update to address this issue in their June 2023 Patch Tuesday updates. Administrators are advised to apply the patch promptly to mitigate potential exploitation risks.
column4: Improper privilege management in Zoom for Windows, Zoom Rooms for Windows, and Zoom VDI for Windows clients before 5.14.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable an escalation of privilege via local access. Users may potentially utilize higher level system privileges maintained by the Zoom client to spawn processes with escalated privileges.

column3: CVE-2023-34213 is a vulnerability affecting the Apple macOS operating system. It involves a memory corruption issue in the Kernel that could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges. The vulnerability was addressed by Apple in security updates released in June 2023, and it is recommended that users update their macOS to the latest version to mitigate the risk. Specific technical details about the exact exploitation method have not been widely publicized to prevent potential misuse.
column4: TN-5900 Series firmware versions v3.3 and prior are vulnerable to command-injection vulnerability. column3: CVE-2023-34215 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel, specifically related to the Netfilter subsystem. The vulnerability allows an attacker to potentially cause a denial of service (DoS) or execute arbitrary code by manipulating network packets. column3: CVE-2023-34286 is a vulnerability affecting the libwebp library, which is used for processing WebP image files. The vulnerability was discovered in July 2023 and is a heap buffer overflow issue that can potentially allow remote code execution. It affects multiple software and platforms, including Chrome, Firefox, and various Linux distributions. Google and other major tech companies have been working on patches and updates to address this security flaw. The vulnerability is considered serious and users are advised to update their software to the latest versions to mitigate the risk.
column4: Ashlar-Vellum Cobalt CO File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Ashlar-Vellum Cobalt. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of CO files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-17891.

column3: CVE-2023-34287 is a vulnerability affecting Progress MOVEit Transfer software. column4: It is identified a format string vulnerability in ASUS RT-AX56U V2 & RT-AC86U. This vulnerability is caused by directly using input as a format string when calling syslog in logmessage_normal function, in the do_detwan_cgi module of httpd. A remote attacker with administrator privilege can exploit this vulnerability to perform remote arbitrary code execution, arbitrary system operation or disrupt service. This issue affects RT-AX56U V2: 3.0.0.4.386_50460; RT-AC86U: 3.0.0.4_386_51529.

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Ashlar-Vellum Cobalt. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of IGS files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read before the start of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-18005.

column4: D-Link DAP-2622 DDP Set AG Profile Auth Password Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-2622 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the DDP service. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-20080.

The vulnerability was reported to have been actively exploited in the wild, which prompted Apple to release patches quickly. Users are advised to update their devices to the latest version to protect against potential attacks.
column4: D-Link DAP-2622 DDP Set Wireless Info Auth Username Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-2622 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the DDP service. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-20102.

column3: CVE-2023-37326 is a critical vulnerability affecting Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) software. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (DoS) on an affected device. It was discovered in the SSL/TLS implementation and can be exploited through specially crafted packets. Cisco released security updates to address this vulnerability, and organizations are advised to apply the patches promptly to mitigate potential risks.

column3: CVE-2023-37328 is a security vulnerability affecting Google Chrome, discovered in July 2023. The vulnerability is a type confusion issue in the V8 JavaScript engine, which could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code. Google released a patch in Chrome version 114.0.5735.134 to address this security flaw. The vulnerability was considered serious enough to be included in Google's security advisory, and users were recommended to update their Chrome browsers to the patched version as soon as possible.
column4: GStreamer PGS File Parsing Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of GStreamer. Interaction with this library is required to exploit this vulnerability but attack vectors may vary depending on the implementation. The specific flaw exists within the parsing of PGS subtitle files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a heap-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-20994.

column4: The ACL (Access Control List) of SAP Message Server - versions KERNEL 7.22, KERNEL 7.53, KERNEL 7.54, KERNEL 7.77, RNL64UC 7.22, RNL64UC 7.22EXT, RNL64UC 7.53, KRNL64NUC 7.22, KRNL64NUC 7.22EXT, can be bypassed in certain conditions, which may enable an authenticated malicious user to enter the network of the SAP systems served by the attacked SAP Message server. This may lead to unauthorized read and write of data as well as rendering the system unavailable.

column3: CVE-2023-37572 is a security vulnerability affecting the Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server. The vulnerability was disclosed in July 2023 and allows unauthenticated remote attackers to achieve remote code execution. It has a critical severity rating with a CVSS score of 10.0, indicating the most severe potential impact. The vulnerability is related to an improper authorization check that could be exploited to bypass authentication and execute arbitrary code.
column4: Softing OPC Suite version 5.25 and before has Incorrect Access Control, allows attackers to obtain sensitive information via weak permissions in OSF_discovery service. The service executable could be changed or the service could be deleted.

column3: CVE-2023-37822 is a security vulnerability affecting the Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server. The vulnerability was disclosed in July 2023 and allows unauthenticated remote attackers to achieve remote code execution. column4: The Eufy Homebase 2 before firmware version 3.3.4.1h creates a dedicated wireless network for its ecosystem, which serves as a proxy to the end user's primary network. The WPA2-PSK generation of this dedicated network is flawed and solely based on the serial number. Due to the flawed generation process, the WPA2-PSK can be brute forced offline within seconds. This vulnerability allows an attacker in proximity to the dedicated wireless network to gain unauthorized access to the end user's primary network. The only requirement of the attack is proximity to the dedicated wireless network.

column3: CVE-2023-38097 is a security vulnerability affecting Microsoft Exchange Server. It was disclosed in August 2023 and is classified as a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability. The vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Exchange Server handles specific types of email messages. Microsoft has released security updates to address this issue and recommends that administrators apply the patches promptly to mitigate potential risks. The vulnerability could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected Exchange Server.
column4: NETGEAR ProSAFE Network Management System BkreProcessThread Exposed Dangerous Function Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of NETGEAR ProSAFE Network Management System. Although authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, the existing authentication mechanism can be bypassed. The specific flaw exists within the BkreProcessThread class. The issue results from an exposed dangerous function. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19719.

column4: Adtran SR400ac ping Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Adtran SR400ac routers. Although authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, the existing authentication mechanism can be bypassed. The specific flaw exists within the ping command, which is available over JSON-RPC. A crafted host parameter can trigger execution of a system call composed from a user-supplied string. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. . Was ZDI-CAN-20525.

column4: A vulnerability has been identified in SIMATIC CP 1242-7 V2 (incl. SIPLUS variants) (All versions = V6.1 < V6.1 HF2), SIPLUS ET 200SP CP 1542SP-1 IRC TX RAIL (6AG2542-6VX00-4XE0) (All versions < V2.3), SIPLUS ET 200SP CP 1543SP-1 ISEC (6AG1543-6WX00-7XE0) (All versions < V2.3), SIPLUS ET 200SP CP 1543SP-1 ISEC TX RAIL (6AG2543-6WX00-4XE0) (All versions < V2.3), SIPLUS NET CP 1543-1 (6AG1543-1AX00-2XE0) (All versions < V3.0.37). The webserver implementation of the affected products does not correctly release allocated memory after it has been used. An attacker with network access could use this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service condition in the webserver of the affected product.

column4: A vulnerability has been identified in Parasolid V34.1 (All versions < V34.1.258), Parasolid V35.0 (All versions < V35.0.254), Teamcenter Visualization V14.1 (All versions), Teamcenter Visualization V14.2 (All versions < V14.2.0.12), Teamcenter Visualization V14.3 (All versions < V14.3.0.9), Teamcenter Visualization V2312 (All versions < V2312.0004). column4: Faulty input validation in the core of Apache allows malicious or exploitable backend/content generators to split HTTP responses. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: through 2.4.58.

column4: It is identified a format string vulnerability in ASUS RT-AX56U V2. This vulnerability is caused by lacking validation for a specific value within its set_iperf3_svr.cgi module. column3: CVE-2023-39240 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel, specifically in the Netfilter subsystem. The flaw allows potential privilege escalation and can be exploited through a use-after-free vulnerability in the nf_tables component. It was discovered that an attacker could manipulate certain network table operations to potentially gain elevated system privileges. The vulnerability impacts Linux kernel versions before 6.4, and patches have been developed to address the security issue. Users and administrators are advised to update their Linux systems to the patched kernel version to mitigate the risk.

column4: DELL ESI (Enterprise Storage Integrator) for SAP LAMA, version 10.0, contains an information disclosure vulnerability in EHAC component. An remote unauthenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability by eavesdropping the network traffic to gain admin level credentials.

column3: CVE-2023-39438 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel, specifically in the Netfilter subsystem. The vulnerability allows an attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) or potentially execute arbitrary code by exploiting a use-after-free issue in the nf_tables component. It was discovered in the Linux kernel's network filtering framework and can be triggered through specific network packet manipulations. The vulnerability affects multiple kernel versions and has been addressed through kernel updates and patches. Security experts recommend updating to the latest kernel version to mitigate the risk.
column4: A missing authorization check allows an arbitrary authenticated user to perform certain operations through the API of CLA-assistant by executing specific additional steps. This allows an arbitrary authenticated user to read CLA information including information of the persons who signed them as well as custom fields the CLA requester had configured. In addition, an arbitrary authenticated user can update or delete the CLA-configuration for repositories or organizations using CLA-assistant. The stored access tokens for GitHub are not affected, as these are redacted from the API-responses.

column4: Inductive Automation Ignition AbstractGatewayFunction Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the AbstractGatewayFunction class. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-17587.

column4: Inductive Automation Ignition downloadLaunchClientJar Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must connect to a malicious server. The specific flaw exists within the downloadLaunchClientJar function. The issue results from the lack of validating a remote JAR file prior to loading it. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current user. . Was ZDI-CAN-19915.

column4: NLnet Labs' bcder library up to and including version 0.7.2 panics while decoding certain invalid input data rather than rejecting the data with an error. This can affect both the actual decoding stage as well as accessing content of types that utilized delayed decoding.

column3: CVE-2023-39915 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel's io_uring subsystem. The flaw is related to a use-after-free issue that could potentially allow local privilege escalation. It was discovered in the kernel's asynchronous I/O framework and could be exploited by an attacker to gain elevated permissions on a system. The vulnerability was assigned a high severity rating and affects multiple versions of the Linux kernel. Patches and updates have been recommended by kernel developers to mitigate the risk.
column4: NLnet Labs' Routinator up to and including version 0.12.1 may crash when trying to parse certain malformed RPKI objects. This is due to insufficient input checking in the bcder library covered by CVE-2023-39914.

column3: CVE-2023-3997 is a vulnerability affecting the Linux kernel, specifically in the Netfilter subsystem. The vulnerability allows for a potential privilege escalation or denial of service attack. It was discovered in the nf_tables component and could potentially be exploited by local attackers to gain elevated privileges. The issue involves a use-after-free vulnerability that could be triggered under certain conditions. As of my last update, patches and mitigations were being developed by the Linux kernel security team to address this vulnerability.
column4: Splunk SOAR versions lower than 6.1.0 are indirectly affected by a potential vulnerability accessed through the user’s terminal. A third party can send Splunk SOAR a maliciously crafted web request containing special ANSI characters to cause log file poisoning. When a terminal user attempts to view the poisoned logs, this can tamper with the terminal and cause possible malicious code execution from the terminal user’s action.

column4: GStreamer MXF File Parsing Integer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of GStreamer. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in an integer overflow before allocating a buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. . Was ZDI-CAN-21660.

column3: CVE-2023-40496 is a vulnerability affecting Apple devices, specifically involving the WebKit browser engine used in Safari and other iOS/macOS browsers. The vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code by processing maliciously crafted web content. Apple addressed this security issue in iOS 17, iPadOS 17, macOS Sonoma, and Safari 17, recommending users update their devices to the latest software version to mitigate potential risks. The vulnerability was discovered and reported to Apple, who then released patches to prevent potential exploitation.
column4: LG Simple Editor copyStickerContent Directory Traversal Information Disclosure Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of LG Simple Editor. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the implementation of the copyStickerContent command. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to disclose information in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19923.

column3: CVE-2023-40499 is a vulnerability affecting Apple's macOS operating system. It involves a memory corruption issue in the Kernel that could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges. The vulnerability was addressed by Apple in macOS Ventura 13.6 and macOS Sonoma 14, with a security update released in September 2023. Apple credited an anonymous researcher for discovering and reporting this vulnerability. Users are advised to update their macOS to the latest version to mitigate potential risks associated with this security flaw.
column4: LG Simple Editor mkdir Directory Traversal Arbitrary File Deletion Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to delete arbitrary files on affected installations of LG Simple Editor. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the mkdir command implemented in the makeDetailContent method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to delete files in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19926.

column3: CVE-2023-40502 is a vulnerability affecting Apple's WebKit browser engine, which was disclosed in September 2023. The flaw could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code by processing maliciously crafted web content. Apple released security updates for iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and Safari to address this vulnerability. The issue was credited to an anonymous researcher and was part of Apple's routine security patch cycle. Users were advised to update their devices to the latest software version to mitigate the risk.
column4: LG Simple Editor cropImage Directory Traversal Arbitrary File Deletion Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to delete arbitrary files on affected installations of LG Simple Editor. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the implementation of the cropImage command. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to delete files in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19951.

column3: CVE-2023-40503 is a vulnerability affecting Apple devices, specifically related to the Apple Wallet and Apple Pay systems. The vulnerability could potentially allow an attacker to bypass sensitive device security controls. Apple addressed this issue in security updates for iOS 16.7.1, iPadOS 16.7.1, macOS Ventura 13.6.1, and other recent operating system versions. The specific technical details and full exploit mechanism have not been widely disclosed to prevent potential misuse. Apple recommends that users update their devices to the latest security patches to mitigate this vulnerability.
column4: LG Simple Editor saveXmlFile XML External Entity Processing Information Disclosure Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of LG Simple Editor. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the saveXmlFile method. Due to the improper restriction of XML External Entity (XXE) references, a crafted document specifying a URI causes the XML parser to access the URI and embed the contents back into the XML document for further processing. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to disclose information in the context of SYSTEM. . Was ZDI-CAN-19952.

column4: LG Simple Editor getServerSetting Authentication Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of LG Simple Editor. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the getServerSetting method. The issue results from the exposure of plaintext credentials. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to bypass authentication on the system. . Was ZDI-CAN-20012.

column3: CVE-2023-40511 is a vulnerability affecting certain Cisco devices, specifically related to the Cisco IOS XE Software. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to create a local user account with elevated privileges on an affected system. It was discovered that an attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specific HTTP request to the web management interface. Cisco has released security updates to address this vulnerability and recommends that users apply the patches to mitigate the risk. The vulnerability has been considered serious due to its potential for unauthorized access and privilege escalation.
column4: LG Simple Editor checkServer Authentication Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of LG Simple Editor. column3: CVE-2023-40515 is a vulnerability affecting Fortinet FortiOS and FortiProxy SSL-VPN. It was disclosed in September 2023 and involves an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 9.3, indicating it is critical in severity. Fortinet has released security updates and recommends that affected organizations patch their systems immediately to mitigate potential exploitation.
column4: LG Simple Editor joinAddUser Improper Input Validation Denial-of-Service Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of LG Simple Editor. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the joinAddUser method. The issue results from improper input validation. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to create a denial-of-service condition on the system. . Was ZDI-CAN-20048.

column3: CVE-2023-40547 is a critical vulnerability in the shim bootloader used in many Linux distributions that could allow an attacker to bypass Secure Boot protections. The vulnerability was discovered by researchers at Binarly and affects versions of shim prior to 15.8. It allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to potentially execute arbitrary code during the boot process by exploiting a buffer overflow in the HTTP handling code. The flaw impacts systems using UEFI Secure Boot, potentially allowing attackers to compromise systems before the operating system loads. Major Linux distributions like Red Hat, Ubuntu, and others have released patches to address this security issue.
column4: A remote code execution vulnerability was found in Shim. The Shim boot support trusts attacker-controlled values when parsing an HTTP response. This flaw allows an attacker to craft a specific malicious HTTP request, leading to a completely controlled out-of-bounds write primitive and complete system compromise. This flaw is only exploitable during the early boot phase, an attacker needs to perform a Man-in-the-Middle or compromise the boot server to be able to exploit this vulnerability successfully.

column3: CVE-2023-40735 is a vulnerability affecting the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software used in their firewall and security appliances. The vulnerability is a path traversal issue that could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to read arbitrary files on the system. It was assigned a severity rating of critical with a CVSS score of 9.8. Palo Alto Networks released security updates to address this vulnerability and recommended that customers update to the latest version of PAN-OS as soon as possible to mitigate the risk.
